    Jaime Roquero Gimenez

    Statistician by training, I develop rigorous data science tools to help with our understanding of disease. I am curious about multimodal high-dimensional biological datasets that arise in cancer research.

    • San Francisco Bay Area
    • Stanford University
    • Email
    • Google Scholar
    • ORCID
    • Github

    Publications

    I have published several conference papers and journal articles in top-tier venues such as ICML, AISTATS and JMLR. You can also find my articles on my Google Scholar profile.

    Causal Aggregation of Heterogeneous Datasets and Stabilization of Feature Selection Procedures (PhD Thesis)

    Thesis dissertation towards the PhD degree in Statistics at Stanford University.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, "Causal Aggregation of Heterogeneous Datasets and Stabilization of Feature Selection Procedures", Stanford University PhD Dissertation (2022).
    Download Paper

    Identifying Invariant Factors Across Multiple Environments with KL Regression

    We tackle here the problem of irreproducibility due to distribution shift. We develop a new approach to regression where datasets from different sources become data points in a regression where parametrization is done for distribution shifts. This allows us to estimate the causal invariant parameters shared across all distributions.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, and James Zou. "Identifying Invariant Factors Across Multiple Environments with KL Regression." ArXiv pre-print (2020).
    Download Paper

    Improving the Stability of the Knockoff Procedure: Multiple Simultaneous Knockoffs and Entropy Maximization

    Published in International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (AISTATS), 2019

    Stabilizing the knockoff procedure through a novel multiple knockoff sampling approach and an improved optimization problem in the Gaussian case.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, and James Zou. "Improving the stability of the knockoff procedure: Multiple simultaneous knockoffs and entropy maximization." In The 22nd international conference on artificial intelligence and statistics, pp. 2184-2192. PMLR, 2019.
    Download Paper

    Knockoffs for the mass: new feature importance statistics with false discovery guarantees

    Published in International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (AISTATS), 2019

    This work introduces novel methods for building knockoffs from a wide range of covariate distributions beyond multivariate Gaussian.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, Amirata Ghorbani, and James Zou. "Knockoffs for the mass: new feature importance statistics with false discovery guarantees." In The 22nd international conference on artificial intelligence and statistics, pp. 2125-2133. PMLR, 2019.
    Download Paper

    A Unified f-divergence Framework Generalizing VAE and GAN

    We define a generalization of the Variational Auto-Encoder and Generative Adversarial network by redefining the loss through f-divergences.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, and James Zou. "Identifying Invariant Factors Across Multiple Environments with KL Regression." ArXiv pre-print. Accepted at ISIT 2022.
    Download Paper

    Causal aggregation: estimation and inference of causal effects by constraint-based data fusion

    Published in Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR), 2022

    We build a causal estimator by aggregating information from different sources of data where experimental conditions are different, and assumptions on the causal relationship between variables can vary.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez and Dominik Rothenhäusler. "Causal aggregation: estimation and inference of causal effects by constraint-based data fusion." Journal of Machine Learning Research 23, no. 335 (2022): 1-60.
    Download Paper

    Discovering conditionally salient features with statistical guarantees

    Published in International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML), 2019

    We expand the knockoff procedure to tackle the problem of local feature selection.

    Recommended citation: Jaime Roquero Gimenez, and James Zou. "Discovering conditionally salient features with statistical guarantees." In International conference on machine learning, pp. 2290-2298. PMLR, 2019.
    Download Paper
